meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a pygmy in size or stature.
meanings.sent1: The tiny plant had a pygmyish appearance in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The puppy's pygmyish size made it adorable to everyone.
meanings.sent3: The pygmyish kitten tried to climb the giant tree but got stuck halfway.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was so soft, it had a pygmyish quality that made everyone lean in to listen.
meanings.sent5: The pygmyish mushroom seemed to disappear among the tall grass.

meanings.definition: Having qualities or characteristics associated with pygmies.
meanings.sent1: The tribal dance had a pygmyish rhythm that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent2: His pygmyish strength surprised everyone when he lifted the heavy rock.
meanings.sent3: The pygmyish laughter of the children echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as pygmyish as the legendary pygmies of the jungle.
meanings.sent5: The old map had a pygmyish charm that drew adventurers to explore its mysteries.
